Module it.polimi.ingsw.PSP43
Package it.polimi.ingsw.PSP43.server.controller.modelHandlers

Class CellsHandler

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.PSP43.server.controller.modelHandlers.CellsHandler
public class CellsHandler
extends java.lang.Object
CellsHandler has the task to handle all the cells of the board of the game. It has to make consistent the state of the cells with the game and it has some methods to return externally (for example to the logic in the cards) a cell or a group of cells.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    CellsHandler​(GameSession gameSession)
    Non default constructor that initializes all the cells in the board with their coordinates and with the BoardObserver.

    This method finds the number of domes placed on the board.

    This method finds the free opposite position (if it exists) to coordForced (referencing to coordForcer).

    This method finds all the coordinates of the board that are included in the same direction defined from the supplied coordinates.

    • changeStateOfCell

      public void changeStateOfCell​(Cell newDescriptionCell, Coord newCoord)
      Method to update cell's attributes and make them consistent to the game.
      Parameters:
      newDescriptionCell - is a cell received from a client that specifies the new state of a cell, identified by the coordinates supplied
      newCoord - includes the coordinates of the cell that are going to be modified

    • findAllFreeCoords

      public java.util.ArrayList<Coord> findAllFreeCoords()
      This method finds all the free cells of a board and returns their coordinates.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing all the coordinates of the free cells

    • selectAllFreeCoords

      public java.util.ArrayList<Coord> selectAllFreeCoords​(java.util.ArrayList<Coord> positions)
      This method selects all the free cells (no worker and no dome) within a bunch of coordinates supplied by the caller.
      Parameters:
      positions - The coordinates supplied by the caller within which the method has to identify the ones free.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of free coordinates within all the supplied coordinates as parameter of the method.

    • findWorkersNeighbouringCoordsExclude

      public java.util.HashMap<Coord,​java.util.ArrayList<Coord>> findWorkersNeighbouringCoordsExclude​(Player player)
      This method finds all the neighbouring cells for the workers provided from the caller.
      Parameters:
      player - The player used to find the neighbouring positions.
      Returns:
      an HashMap in which the key value are the coordinates of the workers supplied by the caller and the values are all the neighbouring cells of that worker

    • findWorkersNeighbouringCoords

      public java.util.HashMap<Coord,​java.util.ArrayList<Coord>> findWorkersNeighbouringCoords​(Player player)
      This method finds all the Coords neighbouring the workers of the player passed as parameter.
      Parameters:
      player - The player used to find the workers on which has to be identified the neighbouring coordinates.
      Returns:
      The correspondence of worker's coordinate and neighbouring coordinates.

    • findNeighbouringCoords

      public java.util.ArrayList<Coord> findNeighbouringCoords​(Coord coord)
      This method identifies a bunch of coordinates that are neighbours of the one supplied by the caller.
      Parameters:
      coord - The coordinates of which the method has to identify all the neighbouring coordinates.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of coordinates representing all the neighbours of the coordinates supplied by the caller.

    • findSameDirectionCoords

      public java.util.ArrayList<Coord> findSameDirectionCoords​(Coord initialPosition, Coord finalPosition)
      This method finds all the coordinates of the board that are included in the same direction defined from the supplied coordinates. (e.g init = 0,1, final = 0,2, returnValue = (0,3),(0,4))
      Parameters:
      initialPosition - the initial position from where I have to define the direction to identify the other cells
      finalPosition - the final position that defines the direction into which I have to look for the cells
      Returns:
      all the cells (apart the initial and final) that are included into the same direction defined looking from initial to final position and following them

    • getCells

      public java.util.ArrayList<Cell> getCells​(java.util.ArrayList<Coord> coordsToMatch)
      This method gets all the cells that are related to the coordinates supplied by the caller.
      Parameters:
      coordsToMatch - the coordinates for which the method has to find all related cells
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing all the related cells to the coordinates contained into the ArrayList supplied

    • findNumberOfDomes

      public int findNumberOfDomes()
      This method finds the number of domes placed on the board.
      Returns:
      The number of domes placed on the board.

    • isPerimetral

      public boolean isPerimetral​(Coord c)
      This method finds if the position referenced on the board by the Coord passed as parameter is on perimeter or not.
      Parameters:
      c - The coordinate that has to be checked if it is on the perimeter or not.
      Returns:
      True if the position referenced on the board by the Coord passed as parameter is on perimeter, false otherwise.

    • isOppositeCoordFree

      public boolean isOppositeCoordFree​(Coord coordForcer, Coord coordForced)
      This method finds if the opposite position (if it exists) to coordForced (referencing to coordForcer) is free.
      Parameters:
      coordForcer - The coordinate referencing to the opposite position has to be found.
      coordForced - The coordinate that is the reference to find the opposite coordinate.
      Returns:
      True if the position opposite to coordForced (referencing to coordForcer) is free, false otherwise.

    • findOppositeCoordFree

      public Coord findOppositeCoordFree​(Coord coordForcer, Coord coordForced)
      This method finds the free opposite position (if it exists) to coordForced (referencing to coordForcer).
      Parameters:
      coordForcer - The coordinate referencing to the opposite position has to be found.
      coordForced - The coordinate that is the reference to find the opposite coordinate.
      Returns:
      The free position opposite to coordForced (referencing to coordForced).
